casebody.data:
Case No. 1,995. BROWN v. BURROWS. District Court, S. D. New York. Aug. 5, 1837. [See The Packet, Case No. 10,055; The Virgin, 8 Pet. (38 U. S.) 538; Sheppard v. Taylor, 5 Pet. (30 U. S.) 709; The Phebe, Case No. 11,065.] [Before BETTS, District Judge.]

Practice in Admiralty — Causes Determined According to Principles op Natural Justice.

[Cited in Ben. Adm. 218, to the point that causes in admiralty are to be determined upon equitable principles, and according to the rules of natural justice, since the American admiralty finds in the educated reason and cultivated discretion of the court the means of *360defeating chicanery, rectifying mistakes, and supplying deficiencies.]

[Note. Nowhere reported; opinion not now accessible.]
